title: Voyageurs National Park: Preservation
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Preservation               Preservation       Many preservation resources for the National Park Service are available online. Check out the following sites for any additional information. National Park Service History E-Library- The National Park Service's History e-Library contains thousands of electronic publications covering the history of the National Park Service and the units comprising the National Park System. We invite you to learn more about history and how the National Park Service works to preserve it. Preservation Briefs- Preservation Briefs provide guidance on preserving, rehabilitating, and restoring historic buildings. These NPS Publications help historic building owners recognize and resolve common problems prior to work. Conserve-O-Grams- Both experienced and inexperienced museum staff responsible for the care and use of museum collections can find short, focused leaflets about caring for museum objects, published in loose-leaf format.
